Summary Throughout my 15 years at Intel – both Intel International Subsidiaries as well as HQ – I’ve delivered business results in the form of: 
•	Driving Business: Led a team of finance professionals to deliver over $9 Billion Revenue a year, complex financial analysis and modeling and Influencing Strategies. Managed Annual Budgets of over $600M, partnering with VPs and GMs World Wide in multi-year projects, which delivered increased return on investment, efficiencies and simplicity for the company’s customers. Negotiated Bank Loans for Latin American Subs. GAAP, Tax Compliance, Accounting activities. Close and Reporting. Budgeting and Planning. Cash Management and Relationships with Banks. Fixed Asset Inventory. Payroll. Financial Statements and its Notes. Relationship with External Auditors. Cash Management. 
•	Risk Management: Managed over $200 Million in Credit Lines in Latin America, maximizing revenue while managing the risk. Key customer turn around – a 3-year effort to turn around one customer’s failing business, expanding free cash flow, optimizing Capex and avoiding bankruptcy, which would have resulted in the loss of ~30% of the Region’s Revenue. Complex relationship building and influencing strategy on GM and Customer’s CEO. Customer and Intel Growth Strategies. Internal Controls – Process improvement and implementation: Self Audits, Standardization. Credit and Collections. 
•	Deals: SSG’s Software Development Center in Cordoba – Argentina. Led negotiations for 9+ months with the Argentine Government to close a complex deal to have Intel’s first Software Development Center in Latin America. Delicate approach that resulted in $25M worth of tax breaks, a free building for the center – paid for by the Provincial Government - and with Intel’s only obligation to hire local employees on an agreed upon schedule.
